item.title: Bangladesh's first fair vote in years comes with a daunting to-do list
item.description: A landmark election in Bangladesh ended years of disputed polls, and now the winners face pressure to tackle corruption and a battered economy.

item.title: US military reports a series of airstrikes against Islamic State targets in Syria
item.description: The U.S. military says the strikes were carried out in retaliation of the December ambush that killed two U.S. soldiers and one American civilian interpreter.

item.title: 5 European nations say Alexei Navalny was poisoned and blame the Kremlin
item.description: In a joint statement, the foreign ministries of the U.K., France, Germany, Sweden and the Netherlands say Navalny was poisoned by Russia with a lethal toxin derived from the skin of poison dart frogs.

item.title: After a 2-decade ban, kites fill Lahore's skies during a Pakistani springtime festival
item.description: People gathered on rooftops to enjoy flying kites for the first time in years, celebrating the spring festival of Basant. The activity had been banned due to injuries and deaths during past celebrations.

item.title: Venezuela debates sweeping amnesty for political prisoners
item.description: After the fall of Nicolás Maduro, the Venezuelan regime promise amnesty and reconciliation — but for hundreds still jailed and thousands facing charges, justice remains uncertain.
